p: Table 1 shows that among the 120 cities, daily mean API was significantly higher in 2013 than in 2012 (75.99 vs. 65.05, p < 0.0001). The average temperature in 193 sample cities was 10.84°C in 2012, and 11.55°C in 2013 ( p < 0.0001). Similar to these, lower average HI and sunshine hours were observed in 2012 than in 2013, except a higher precipitation was observed in 2012 than in 2013. There were no significant differences in the total and per capita GDP (56,197 vs. 59,405, p = 0.557), percentage of residents aged in 60 and older (17.83 vs. 18.21, p = 0.49), and total mortality between 2012 and 2013 (6.15 vs. 6.01‰, p = 0.52).
